DOC.brief_summary: This is a retrospective review of patients who have undergone bariatric surgery at VUMC and who have type 2 Diabetes and/or dyslipidemia. The investigators have previously found that gastric bypass significantly improves diabetes 6-12 months after surgery. The investigators are interested in looking at the longer term results after surgery.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Gastric Bypass on Patients With Type 2 Diabetes and/or Dyslipidemia
DOC.detailed_description: Review and record changes in the subject's medication. subjects vitals: weight, blood pressure, and fasting blood values, which include: - HbA1c - Fasting blood glucose - Fasting Insulin - Lipid Panel ( total cholesterol, LDL, HDL and triglycerides) were obtained.
DOC.criteria: Patients who have had diabetes and/or dyslipidemia prior to gastric bypass. Patients who have had type 2 diabetes that was diet controlled at time of surgery; and debilitated patients who are unable to come in for a physical exam.
DOC.keyword: Gastric by-pass on patients with T2DM
